intro: Listrostachys bicaudata, commonly known as the two-tailed grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
